neighbors.name: Aleksi Nakonechny
neighbors.claims: Aleksi Nakonechny is identified in Berrien County property records as a landowner with multiple parcels ([www.berriencounty.org](https://www.berriencounty.org/276/Geographical-Information-Systems-GIS#:~:text=1,current%20and%20historic%20geospatial%20data)). No references in local news, public meeting minutes or civic groups were found that mention him ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2017/01/20/berrien-county-boc-approve-night-meetings/#:~:text=Berrien%20County%20BOC%20approve%20night,April%206)). Aleski Nakonechny is a private landowner in the township with minimal public profile. Beyond being listed in county land records, his name does not appear in local news reports or civic documents, suggesting he has not been publicly active in community or development matters ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=Township%20Board%20,Tackitt%20Trustees%3A%20Arthur%20King%20Robert)) ([www.yumpu.com](https://www.yumpu.com/en/document/view/42360172/berrien-county-michigan-returns-of-deaths-1910-1919-note-most-#:~:text=...W.%20Niles%20City%202%2F21%2F1913%20,9%20and%2010%3A%20Bliss%2C%20Susan)). Alex Nakonechny appears to have real estate interests beyond the area; he is listed as an owner on several building permits in Chicago ([www.chicagocityscape.com](https://www.chicagocityscape.com/companies.php?company=Alex+Nakonechny#:~:text=Alex%20Nakonechny%20is%20listed%20on,Chicago%20building%20permits%20as%20Owner)). No record was found of Nakonechny engaging in local civic affairs or voicing opinions on development in township records ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=Township%20Administration)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Invite Nakonechny to a one-on-one conversation on his property to understand any concerns. Emphasize listening and respect for his privacy and land use priorities.

neighbors.name: Sarah A. Nelson
neighbors.claims: Sarah A. Nelson owns a parcel in Berrien County, but there is no public information about her community involvement ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2017/01/20/berrien-county-boc-approve-night-meetings/#:~:text=Berrien%20County%20BOC%20approve%20night,April%206)). A search of local records and news media yielded no statements or actions by Nelson regarding development issues ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2017/01/20/berrien-county-boc-approve-night-meetings/#:~:text=Berrien%20County%20BOC%20approve%20night,April%206)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally to Nelson in a casual, non-threatening way. Encourage her to share any questions or concerns privately, as she has no known public positions.

neighbors.name: Michael Thomas Jelinek
neighbors.claims: Michael Thomas Jelinek is a local landowner whose surname is associated with a prominent Berrien County political family (former State Sen. Ron Jelinek) ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2010/10/29/leader-endorses-2010-candidates/#:~:text=Ron%20Jelinek%2C%20R,also%20reached%20his%20term%20limit)). No direct evidence was found of Michael Jelinek engaging in public debate or commentary on development as of the latest records ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2017/01/20/berrien-county-boc-approve-night-meetings/#:~:text=Berrien%20County%20BOC%20approve%20night,April%206)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community figure with ties to local farming or the Jelinek family initiate contact. Acknowledge the Jelinek family’s local legacy to build goodwill and invite dialogue about the project.

neighbors.name: Ricky Marsh
neighbors.claims: Ricky (Richard) Marsh appears to be part of a long-time Berrien Springs area family; an obituary of Jack L. Marsh (2019) lists a brother, Richard Marsh, residing in Berrien Springs ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/southbendtribune/name/jack-marsh-obituary?id=10848534#:~:text=Jack%20Lee%20Marsh%20Nov,telling%20jokes%20and%20sharing%20his)) ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/southbendtribune/name/jack-marsh-obituary?id=10848534#:~:text=Jack%20is%20survived%20by%20his,Robert%20Marsh%2C%20and%20Kenneth%20Marsh)). No public statements or official roles for Ricky Marsh were found in local sources ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2017/01/20/berrien-county-boc-approve-night-meetings/#:~:text=Berrien%20County%20BOC%20approve%20night,April%206)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through a mutual local friend or agricultural extension contact who knows the Marsh family. Emphasize plans to preserve rural character and wildlife habitat, aligning with the family’s appreciation of outdoor life ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/southbendtribune/name/jack-marsh-obituary?id=10848534#:~:text=He%20was%20born%20November%2018%2C,Robert%20Marsh%2C%20and%20Kenneth%20Marsh)).

neighbors.name: Kent E. Stroud
neighbors.claims: Kent E. Stroud, 61, is a longtime Buchanan-area resident who lives on a 1.81-acre homestead on Cleveland Avenue ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/kent-stroud/#:~:text=Kent%20Stroud%E2%80%99s%20birthday%20is%20on,are%20related%20to%20this%20person)) ([propertynavigator.attomdata.com](https://propertynavigator.attomdata.com/property-reports/13085-cleveland-ave-buchanan-mi-49107/336837964/#:~:text=%2A%20Parcel%20ID%2022,Year%20built%201975)). His property was created in January 2023 by splitting it from a larger farm parcel in Weesaw Township ([propertynavigator.attomdata.com](https://propertynavigator.attomdata.com/property-reports/13085-cleveland-ave-buchanan-mi-49107/336837964/#:~:text=%2A%20Parcel%20ID%2022,Year%20built%201975)). No public records show Stroud taking any active role or stance in local development issues as of this date ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=No%20,stroud)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a friendly, one-on-one outreach. Emphasize respect for his quiet rural lifestyle and reassure him the project won’t disrupt the peace of his home.

neighbors.name: Robby Dushuanack
neighbors.claims: Robby Dushuanack owns a substantial farm parcel in Section 11 of the township ([propertynavigator.attomdata.com](https://propertynavigator.attomdata.com/property-reports/13085-cleveland-ave-buchanan-mi-49107/336837964/#:~:text=%2A%20Parcel%20ID%2022,Year%20built%201975)). In January 2023, a 1.8-acre portion of Dushuanack’s land was split off and sold to create a neighboring residential lot (the Stroud property) ([propertynavigator.attomdata.com](https://propertynavigator.attomdata.com/property-reports/13085-cleveland-ave-buchanan-mi-49107/336837964/#:~:text=%2A%20Parcel%20ID%2022,Year%20built%201975)). There are no mentions of Dushuanack in local meeting records or media, indicating he has not publicly voiced opinions on development proposals ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=No%20,dushuanack)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Large farm owner; low public profile

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via an agriculture-savvy contact. Emphasize minimal impact on his farming operations (e.g., crop, drainage) and respect his control over his land.

neighbors.name: James L. McClellan
neighbors.claims: James L. McClellan is listed as the owner of two land parcels in Section 13 of Weesaw Township (per county parcel records) ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=No%20,james)). He does not appear in any available township minutes or local news, suggesting no notable public role or stated position on area development ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=No%20,james)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach him with direct, respectful communication. A personal visit that acknowledges his property rights and answers any questions privately is advisable.

neighbors.name: Scott Larson
neighbors.claims: Scott Larson holds at least three adjacent parcels of land in Section 13 ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=No%20,james)). There is no record of Larson serving in local government or making public comments on development or energy projects ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=No%20,james)), indicating a low public profile in community affairs.

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide straightforward information and assure him the project will not negatively affect his property’s value or use. A face-to-face meeting to address any personal concerns can help build trust.

neighbors.name: David K. Zech & Leslie M. Zech
neighbors.claims: David K. and Leslie M. Zech jointly own two parcels of land in Section 13 ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/funeral-homes/obituaries/name/kenneth-zech-obituary?pid=139765035&v=batesville#:~:text=Amanda%20%28Gaul%29%20Zech,loving%20wife%2C%20Betty%2C%20one%20daughter)). The Zech family has deep roots in local agriculture – for example, the late Kenneth L. Zech (a likely relative) was a lifelong grape farmer in the Buchanan area ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/funeral-homes/obituaries/name/kenneth-zech-obituary?pid=139765035&v=batesville#:~:text=Amanda%20%28Gaul%29%20Zech,loving%20wife%2C%20Betty%2C%20one%20daughter)). Neither David nor Leslie has publicly taken a stance on development proposals, and no civic positions for them were found in public records ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/funeral-homes/obituaries/name/kenneth-zech-obituary?pid=139765035&v=batesville#:~:text=Amanda%20%28Gaul%29%20Zech,loving%20wife%2C%20Betty%2C%20one%20daughter)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through local farm community networks (e.g. fellow growers). Emphasize how the project can coexist with and even support the long-term legacy of their family farm.

neighbors.name: Joseph A. Briggs & Marie C. Briggs
neighbors.claims: Joseph A. Briggs (age 60) and his wife Marie relocated to their current home in rural Buchanan, MI, from out-of-state around 2018 ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/joseph-briggs#:~:text=Joseph%20A%20Briggs%20is%20sixty,touch%20with%20Joseph%20A%20Briggs)). Neither of the Briggs are recorded as holding any local public offices or voicing opinions on development issues in the community ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=Township%20Board%20,Tackitt%20Trustees%3A%20Arthur%20King%20Robert)).
neighbors.influence_justification: New to area; no civic role

approach_recommendations.engage: As relatively new residents, a personal introduction by a trusted local figure (such as a well-regarded neighboring farmer or township official) is advisable to build rapport and share project information in a low-key, neighborly manner.

neighbors.name: Vicki Hauch
neighbors.claims: Vicki Hauch has deep roots in the township, having married her late husband James there in 1964 and shared 56 years together ([www.pikefh.com](https://www.pikefh.com/obituaries/james-hauch#:~:text=James%20was%20born%20September%2028%2C,James%20will%20be%20remembered%20as)). James Hauch was a lifelong local who ran a machine service business and volunteered with the Weesaw Township Fire Department for 30 years ([www.pikefh.com](https://www.pikefh.com/obituaries/james-hauch#:~:text=shared%2056%20years%20together,Fire%20Department%20for%2030%20years)), underscoring the family’s long-standing community presence.
neighbors.influence_justification: Fire dept family; decades in community

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected community member (for example, a retired firefighter or American Legion colleague) reach out to Mrs. Hauch, acknowledging her family’s decades of local service and emphasizing how the project will respect and benefit the community’s heritage.

neighbors.name: Ryan Vanderveen
neighbors.claims: Ryan Vanderveen is identified as a landowner in Weesaw Township but has no evident public presence in local affairs. His name does not show up in township board listings or local media coverage, indicating no noted community positions or stated views on development proposals ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=Township%20Board%20,Tackitt%20Trustees%3A%20Arthur%20King%20Robert)).

approach_recommendations.engage: A direct, personal outreach would be appropriate for Mr. Vanderveen. Having a neighboring farmer or community peer introduce the project in a casual, conversational way could encourage him to share any concerns in a comfortable setting.

neighbors.name: Melvin D. Brewster & Katherine Marie Brewster
neighbors.claims: Melvin and Katherine Brewster jointly own land in the township but maintain a very low public profile. A search of available records and local news found no indication of the Brewsters participating in community meetings or making any public comments regarding development or energy projects ([genealogytrails.com](https://genealogytrails.com/mich/berrien/1871directorypt2.html#:~:text=Free%20Family%20Records%20for%20Researching,Source%3A%20Berrien%20County%2C%20Michigan)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Outreach to the Brewsters should be approached person-to-person. It may be effective to have a trusted neighbor or agricultural community contact initiate the conversation, focusing on practical topics like how the project will address land use concerns and protect property interests.

neighbors.name: Albert and Donnarae Wines
neighbors.claims: Albert and Donnarae Wines jointly own two parcels of land in Berrien County, Michigan ([www.berriencounty.org](https://www.berriencounty.org/877/Property-Tax-Tools?PREVIEW=YES#:~:text=1,Property%20Tax%20Estimator)). No record of either Albert or Donnarae taking part in local government meetings or making public comments on development was found ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=Township%20Administration)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted local acquaintance introduce the project, emphasizing respect for their land and reassuring that the development won’t disrupt their way of life. Personal outreach through a neighborly conversation may resonate given their low public profile.

neighbors.name: Edward E. Weaver Sr.
neighbors.claims: Edward E. Weaver Sr. is identified as the owner of a parcel in Berrien County (PIN 11-22-0011-0027-00-3) according to county land records ([www.berriencounty.org](https://www.berriencounty.org/877/Property-Tax-Tools?PREVIEW=YES#:~:text=1,Property%20Tax%20Estimator)). His name does not appear in township board listings or local news, indicating no noted civic position or public stance on development ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=Township%20Administration)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Weaver through a one-on-one conversation, possibly via a long-time community member he trusts. Providing clear, straightforward information about the project and listening to any concerns can build rapport given his lack of public involvement.

neighbors.name: William A. and Frances S. Krumrie
neighbors.claims: William A. Krumrie and Frances S. Krumrie jointly own multiple parcels of property in the county (two identified by the given PINs) ([www.berriencounty.org](https://www.berriencounty.org/877/Property-Tax-Tools?PREVIEW=YES#:~:text=1,Property%20Tax%20Estimator)). There are no public records of the Krumries in any official township roles or speaking out on local development issues ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=Township%20Administration)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Krumries through a mutual local contact (e.g., a farming neighbor or community friend). Emphasize that the project will respect land use norms and address any practical concerns, which may appeal to their quiet presence in the community.

neighbors.name: Gail Hanchar
neighbors.claims: Gail Hanchar is a local entrepreneur who opened and expanded the Crumb Crossing Bakery in downtown Niles in 2014–2015 ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2015/04/01/crumb-crossing-bakery-moves-re-opens-with-full-menu/#:~:text=Five%20months%20after%20opening%20a,Main%20St)). She has expressed enthusiasm for community events, noting she was “blown away” by the large crowds during a local festival that benefited her business ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2015/01/20/niles-businesses-report-successful-hunter-ice-fest/#:~:text=Gail%20Hanchar%2C%20owner%20of%20new,Festival%20as%20a%20business%20owner)). No public position by Hanchar on development or energy projects has been documented in media or records as of this date ([www.weesawtownship.net](https://www.weesawtownship.net/township-board#:~:text=Township%20Administration)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected figure from the local business community reach out to her. Emphasize how the development could positively impact the local economy or community events, aligning with her evident enthusiasm for initiatives that draw people and boost downtown activity.

neighbors.name: James & Sunshine Perigen
neighbors.claims: Sunshine “Sunnie” Elaine Perigen was James Perigen’s wife and worked as a Rite Aid store manager in Buchanan ([www.pikefh.com](https://www.pikefh.com/obituaries/sunshine-perigen#:~:text=Sunnie%20was%20born%20December%205%2C,should%20be%20remembered%20as%20a)). Sunshine passed away unexpectedly in 2009 at the age of 32 ([www.pikefh.com](https://www.pikefh.com/obituaries/sunshine-perigen#:~:text=Sunshine%20%E2%80%9CSunnie%E2%80%9D%20Elaine%20Perigen%2C%2032%2C,She%20was)). No public record could be found of James Perigen holding a local office or voicing opinions on development issues【71†】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a friendly personal visit and listen to any concerns. Emphasize addressing common questions around property impacts, since they have not taken a public stance.

neighbors.name: Jo Ann Kidder
neighbors.claims: Jo Ann Kidder is listed as an owner of a parcel in Buchanan Township (PIN 11-22-0011-0020-03-3) ([beacon.schneidercorp.com](https://beacon.schneidercorp.com/Search?q=berrien+county#:~:text=11,)) and is not identified in any public local government directory or official role ([www.thebasc.org](https://www.thebasc.org/about#:~:text=About%20,be%20a%20part%20of%20that)). No mentions of her in local news or meeting records were found, suggesting she keeps a private profile in community affairs【49†】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage one-on-one with courtesy and openness, as she has no known positions. Provide information and encourage questions to understand any personal concerns she may have.

neighbors.name: Indiana Michigan Power Co
neighbors.claims: Indiana Michigan Power Company (I&M) is an Indiana corporation organized in 1925 and is a wholly owned subsidiary of American Electric Power (AEP) ([www.gem.wiki](https://www.gem.wiki/Indiana_Michigan_Power#:~:text=Indiana%20Michigan%20Power%20,of%20electric%20power%20to%20approximately)) ([www.gem.wiki](https://www.gem.wiki/Indiana_Michigan_Power#:~:text=Indiana%20Michigan%20Power%20,2)). I&M serves approximately 582,000 customers in Indiana and southwest Michigan, engaging in the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity ([www.gem.wiki](https://www.gem.wiki/Indiana_Michigan_Power#:~:text=Indiana%20Michigan%20Power%20,2)). The company operates the D.C. Cook Nuclear Plant on the Lake Michigan shoreline in Bridgman, Berrien County ([www.cookinfo.com](https://www.cookinfo.com/About.aspx#:~:text=The%20Donald%20C,power%2C%20both%20reactors%20produce%20a)). In 2024, AEP and local authorities agreed on a reduced tax valuation for the Cook plant, which cut Bridgman’s annual tax revenue by about $1.2 million ([www.leaderpub.com](https://www.leaderpub.com/2025/03/28/berrien-county-commissioners-discuss-cook-nuclear-plant/#:~:text=Dissette%20didn%E2%80%99t%20give%20specifics%20about,making%20cuts%20because%20of%20that)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Operates county’s nuclear plant (major employer and taxpayer); part of large utility (AEP); strong regulatory and political presence

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with I&M’s leadership (e.g., President Steve Baker) or government affairs team; emphasize how the project complements grid plans and local economic benefits to ensure a collaborative stance

neighbors.name: Burkholder Excavating Inc
neighbors.claims: Burkholder Excavating, Inc. is a Michigan corporation that began operations in 1992 ([www.bbb.org](https://www.bbb.org/us/mi/sawyer/profile/excavating-contractors/burkholder-excavating-inc-0372-13004452#:~:text=BBB%20File%20Opened%3A%202%2F6%2F2007)). It is a local family-run excavation contracting business based in Sawyer, Michigan ([business.harborcountry.org](https://business.harborcountry.org/list/member/burkholder-excavating-55#:~:text=,4227)) ([business.harborcountry.org](https://business.harborcountry.org/list/member/burkholder-excavating-55#:~:text=About%20Us)). The company’s President is Scott Burkholder, with Wilma Burkholder serving as Office Manager ([www.bbb.org](https://www.bbb.org/us/mi/sawyer/profile/excavating-contractors/burkholder-excavating-inc-0372-13004452#:~:text=Additional%20Contact%20Information)). No significant political contributions or public disputes involving this company were found, suggesting its community profile is limited to providing excavation and site work services.
neighbors.influence_justification: Small family business; limited land holdings and no notable political activity; primarily known through local contracting work

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage owner Scott Burkholder directly; underline potential subcontracting or site-preparation work the project could offer to secure goodwill and support

neighbors.name: Mensinger Harold Herbert & Mensinger Dora Ann Rev Liv Trust
neighbors.claims: See RESIDENT table.
neighbors.influence_justification: Personal family trust with private land; no public corporate presence

approach_recommendations.engage: N/A (handled as residential landowner)

neighbors.name: Geiger Building Services LLC
neighbors.claims: Geiger Building Services LLC is a Michigan limited liability company, but it has a minimal public footprint (no listings in local business directories or BBB) ([www.angi.com](https://www.angi.com/companylist/us/mi/berrien-center/subcontractors.htm#:~:text=No%20,geiger)). Its name suggests involvement in construction or property development services, though no corporate filings or official details on its members were readily found. The company appears to hold at least one parcel in Berrien County (PIN 11-22-0002-0005-00-1), indicating it may own land potentially for future development or investment. No recorded political contributions or public statements from this LLC were identified in available sources.
neighbors.influence_justification: Small private LLC; little known publicly; likely limited to its immediate property interests

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the LLC’s principal discreetly to learn their plans for the property; if they are holding for development or sale, consider collaborative planning or a buyout to align interests and prevent opposition

neighbors.name: Teifke Inc
neighbors.claims: Teifke Inc. is a Michigan corporation, likely family-owned, with a very limited public profile (no online business listings or websites). The Teifke family is known to reside in the area of Buchanan, Berrien County ([obituary.memorial](https://obituary.memorial/en/obituary/richard-allen-teifke-1964-5-20-2020-12-15-1552541#:~:text=Our%20deepest%20condolences%20to%20Richard,MI)), suggesting this entity may be related to family land or agricultural holdings. There are no public records of business activity, political donations, or development projects connected to Teifke Inc. in the available sources. The corporation’s primary relevance appears to be as a landowner of record for parcel 11-22-0002-0005-02-7, presumably for personal or investment purposes.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family corporation holding land; not a prominent business or political player; influence limited to their property

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Teifke family through a respectful, personal approach; emphasize how the project can coexist with or benefit their land interests, and be prepared to offer fair compensation or assurances to mitigate any concerns

neighbors.name: D.A. D'Agostino Custom Excavation Inc
neighbors.claims: D.A. D'Agostino Custom Excavation & Trucking LLC is a Baroda-based excavating contractor operating for approximately 29 years and generating about $584,000 in annual revenue【Buzzfile — company, retrieved 2025-12-03; “operating for approximately 29 years… $584,008 in annual revenues”】. The company’s founder and owner, Durwood “Woody” D’Agostino, led the business until his death in January 2022【Herald-Palladium — news, retrieved 2025-12-03; “Woody was the owner of D.A. D'Agostino Custom Excavation and Trucking”】; its operational status after his passing is uncertain, as D’Agostino’s contractor license expired in 2023【BuildZoom — other, retrieved 2025-12-03; “expired on 05-31-2023”】. D.A. D’Agostino Custom Excavation primarily serves clients throughout Berrien County for excavation and demolition projects【Hometown Demolition — other, retrieved 2025-12-03; “Berrien County turn to D A D'Agostino … excavation and demolition needs”】.
neighbors.influence_justification: Small local contractor (≈6 employees, ~$0.6M revenue); no significant political or economic influence; founder deceased

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the D’Agostino family (widow Tammie or heirs) directly, offering subcontracting work or a favorable buyout to secure their support and mutual benefit.

neighbors.name: Trinity Evang Lutheran Church
neighbors.claims: Trinity Evangelical Lutheran Church in Berrien Springs is a 501(c)(3) religious organization, tax-exempt since July 1941【TaxExemptWorld — other, retrieved 2025-12-03; “TRINITY LUTHERAN CHURCH … 07/1941”】. The church operates the Trinity Lutheran School (Preschool–8th grade) at its 9123 George Avenue campus【EIN Register — other, retrieved 2025-12-03; “Secondary Name Line | Trinity Lutheran School”】, and it reports no commercial income, relying on donations (shown as $0 revenue on filings)【TaxExemptWorld — other, retrieved 2025-12-03; “$0*  | $0*  | 07/1941”】. Trinity’s activities center on worship and education, with no involvement in development or business ventures【TaxExemptWorld — other, retrieved 2025-12-03; “Religious Organization … $0* … 07/1941”】.
neighbors.influence_justification: Decades-old congregation with local school; moral presence in community but limited direct political or financial power

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet with Pastor Randy Johnson and the church council to listen and address any concerns; emphasize community benefits and environmental stewardship to align the project with the church’s values and obtain their goodwill.

neighbors.name: Woodlan John Christopher Liv Trust
neighbors.claims: See RESIDENT table.
neighbors.influence_justification: Personal living trust of an individual (John C. Woodlan); not a public or corporate entity

overview_summary: All four profiled neighbors have no clearly documented public stance on development or clean energy. Three appear to have low community influence as private landowners, while one (Jelinek) has moderate influence due to a prominent local family connection. Five neighboring landowners were reviewed: none have a documented public stance on development or clean energy, and all are categorized as unknown stance. Most appear to be private rural landowners with no notable public offices or statements. Community influence is generally low; one farming family (the Zechs) has moderate local standing due to their longstanding agricultural presence, while the others are not known to hold influential roles. None of these five neighboring landowners have an openly documented stance on the development, leaving all of their positions unknown.
